title: Jia ZHANG (张佳)
text: I’m Jia, a Ph.D. student at Department of Finance at Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. Feel free to email me .

title: Jia ZHANG (张佳)

title: Jia ZHANG (张佳)
text:
Research Interests
I’m interested in information transmission, belief formation, and persuasion in the financial market when social networks (especially social media) are present and how they affect trading behavior and asset prices.

title: Research
text:
Meme Trading and Social Transmission Bias with Slides, Fall 2022.
Abstract
This paper surveys the emergent literature on meme trading, an evolutionary view of financial markets in the presence of social networks, in response to the fables of social finance in David Hirshleifer’s presidential address. I discussed recent literature on four subtopics of meme trading including attention, network structure, social transmission biases, and narratives and interpretation. I highlighted their relations and listed the questions that await answering. I also provided a critical review of Cookson et al.(2022), which uses echo chambers, a type of social transmission bias, to explain persistent disagreement and high trading volume.

title: JIA
text:
Who am I?
I grew up in Neijiang, a small city in Sichuan, China.






I like:

science fiction

My favorite authors include Stanisław Lem, Douglas Adams and Ted Chiang.

cooking

It helps me enter “flow state” (otherwise my life would be in danger). Besides, I cook well with recipes.

stand-up comedy and comedies in general

my top-5 comedy show:

Louie (by Louis C.K.)
Nathan for You (by Nathan Fielder)
Community (by Dan Harmon)
Black Books (by Dylan Moran)
Fleabag Season 2 (by Phoebe Waller-Bridge)









I don’t like:

small talks

Why would people ask questions they don’t want to know answers to?

hiking

No one needs to do exactly what Sisyphos does to know that life is meaningless.



I now live on campus. I love the weather in Hong Kong and the view of sea.
I enjoy sharing the campus with wild boars and dogs because they remind me that compared to them I’m an apeman.
